comment: As what the other user had mentioned, the class itself was pretty much a breeze. However, the professor doesn't grade assignments in a timely manner. There is a lack of communication regarding to emails.

Class itself was not that difficult however it was extremely hard to get in contact with her. She barely responded to emails and I took her for a summer class and the class itself was not set up for hw and exams to open on the summer syllabus. Also, she did not grade anything throughout the class making it very difficult to know your actual grade.

I took the seven week online class. There was zero interaction with her and she didn't respond to any of my emails, so she's not really accessible. You're pretty much on your own with your learning. Content wise, the class really wasn't that bad. Homework was just time consuming cause it's a shortened class. Maybe she's better for in-person ┐(´ー｀)┌
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Honestly not a good teacher, especially online. Its hard to get in touch with her and there is no lectures outside of the program we use so you basically teach yourself. For it being elementary the test are harder than they need to be. She also takes 2 weeks to grade exams without any feedback so you don't know how your doing in the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: There has been little to no interaction at all with her in this class. She does not reply to emails for weeks at a time, if ever, does not update exam grades to reflect the spoken or written parts. Relies ONLY on assignments given by textbook website, and does not provide her own lectures, feedback, or anything. Teaching yourself entirely!

For an online class, she isn't great. Overall, her course work isn't hard, but she doesn't grade things in a timely manner and posts the work for the week late a little too often. Its hard to know how you're doing overall when grades aren't completed and the grade book on D2L is not lined up with the one on the other website she uses.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Figueroa is actually not half bad, even online. Although it took a while for several grades to come in, she was cordial, and her homework is not super hard. I believe her face-to-face class might be easier, but if you need an easy class online for Spanish, take her!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Profe Neysa is absolutely amazing. She is super understanding and helpful. I don't have her as a professor anymore, but I still go see her when I can
I took Professor Figueroa for the summer semester online. The class was easy to follow and the homework was helpful. She was very caring and flexible. Would definitely take her again.

Took her Spanish1001 online. Arguably the worst academic decision I have ever made. She doesn't answer emails. Doesn't add things to the course schedule until a few days before deadline. Told us she was sick, not to worry abt deadlines until she emailed us back. The next email she sent was 2 weeks later saying to get ready for 1st assessment. 0/10

worst decision I've ever made. Spanish is so easy and she's such a nice professor, but taking this class online was horrible. I was always stressing out about work because she's not very clear about anything. She also doesn't put up work until last minute. She never replies to her emails either.

Prof. Figueroa gives clear expectations for the class as well as a course calendar, which she doesn't stick to. She went MIA 3 weeks into the course and didn't give any explanation when she came back at the end of October. Very inaccessible by email, hard to reach. All work is done in online program, so not too much of an issue that she was gone.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She cares about her students and will work with you on deadlines if personal matters prevent you from turning in the work on time. She did not put in a single grade the entire semester, but there were several papers that had to be turned in. Participation is mandatory to pass, with several class presentations. Overall I enjoyed the class.

She is very nice, but she definitely speaks in mostly Spanish. I took 4 years of Honors in HS so I was well prepared for this class. I did not think it was too difficult, but a lot of other students felt she was too hard on the class. Overall, I hope to take her again in a upper level Spanish class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's brilliant, but I'm not at all surprised that people who had her for lower level classes had a rough time. She has the highest expectations of any Spanish professor I've had, and the material in 4456 is challenging. Difficult as it was though, I think she's a great prof and if you're serious about Spanish, you should absolutely take her.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is a very sweet prof but I don't think she should be teaching a first year spanish class. I took spanish for 4 years and had to work hard to get an A. There is a lot of homework and you need to show up and participate bc she does grade participation and I talked in every class and got an 80 for participation. Very understanding and kind though
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I would not recommend taking this class if you are not incredibly familiar with the Spanish language. She only speaks in Spanish and very little English. Her grading components change throughout the semester and online homework due date times change constantly. Attendance is a big part of your final grade and she is not lenient on any extra days.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This is a very good class and I learned a lot.  Not the easiest material but very enjoyable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: My biggest complaints are that this teacher takes a year to grade and expects so much out of first year students. I took three years in high school and still had to really work hard in this class. She's a nice person, but class participation is miserable, lots of online homework, and would say it's pretty difficult to get an A.
That teacher is awesome, nice good looking from Puerto Rico, smiles all the time and is lovely at everything ... I just love her.

Very easy class if your decent at speaking Spanish. Class assignments are extremely simple and the main grade is your interview at the end of the semester just to see if you learned anything. only thing bad was not doing anything challenging that will actually increase your spanish speaking overall
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Fun course. Great professor.

She's great. Not too much work either. She answers all questions. She makes jokes too sometimes. She's very understanding and patient. Sometimes she's a little annoying with the group activities in class, but she's great still. She's super happy all the time.

I've never seen a more rude professor. If she does not like a specific student, it's obvious as she will single them out and have attitude regardless of if the interaction is in the middle of class in front of other students. She made me feel uncomfortable with how uncomfortable she made other students feel. We never did anything challenging though

She's a great teacher. Baseline and final interview with analysis paper on it. Classes are revolved around 3 movies with a couple of responses. 2 mini-presentations. ATTENDANCE IS SUPER IMPORTANT. Many extra credit opportunities. The only downfall is that you don't know your grade all semester and never returns assignments with any grades. Take her

I didn't work very hard. Im a b student. I did do all the homework and some extra credit opportunities that she offered, which she did offer a lot of. Ended up with an A in there, no way you should get any other grade in this class.  Just come to class and do the homework. Test are fine. Awesome lady!!

Ms. Figueroa is such a sweet woman! She's always willing to help you whenever you need it. You definitely need to teach yourself though and make sure you do the homework!!  Easy A for an entry level spanish class.

Dr. Figueroa is an amazing professor! She expects you to be ready for class. There were not many tests, but two main interviews, few papers, and events to go to. She is very helpful which whatever one needs and is willing to help if you are willing to work for it! I would gladly take her again for the higher levels classes! Take her!
SUPER hard material

This professor will make you feel so comfortable in the class. Practical conversation was super easy BUT attendance is EXTREMELY important. It can quickly drop your letter grade. The class is really laid back and some times there  is confusion on what exactly she wants but she will answer all questions. I would recommend dr figueroa to anyone.
The material itself is difficult but Dr. Figueroa is truly a sweetheart and helps you out if goes about your final grade.

Dr. Figueroa is by far my favorite foreign language professor at KSU. She was always encouraging towards all her students and her classes are engaging and enjoyable. Everyone should take her for at least one Spanish class. I wish more professors were like her. :)

I LOVE HER! she is a great teacher and is very helpful. I took her for practical Conversations and was scared to death of taking it but she made it very comfortable. We watched movies throughout the semester. Only problem was that there was a lot of outside required work. Lab hours, cultural events, etc. I have a job so it was tough. GREAT TEACHER!

She does speak mostly in spanish, but slow enough to understand. If you do all of the assignments and put a little effort you'll make a good grade. She grades based on individual progress, so your grade depends on YOUR improvement! She makes attendance mandatory, but you kind of need to be there to practice to improve anyway. Very nice and helpful.
She makes class both fun and interesting. Speaks mostly in Spanish, but does so slowly so that everyone can follow along. She's also very attractive.

Great professor, you have to read a lot on your own and expect to study out side of class. She uses  Vista a lot to communicate. Not hard at all if you do the work. There are three papers that have to be a page long in spanish!
No Comments
really nice teacher. doesn't load you down with tons of work! had many class presentations and watched videos that corresponded with the book in class! i'm taking her again for intermediate span 1.

The subject itself is not easy.However, Figueroa really wants everyone to understand and will happily answer any and all questions (even e-mails).The HW, Journal, and Project grades help to outweigh the bad exam grades.I believe the avg. grade was a 70-75 but it was WAY worse when Bernardi taught it!
